intro: Anthospermum rigidum subsp. rigidum, commonly known as the rigid antospermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. This species is often found in open grasslands and disturbed sites, showing a preference for well-drained soils.
